summary:
I work as an independent Business Community Builder and have spent over '10.000 hours' in "organizing value" by connecting people, ideas and organizations in Business Communities since 1988. I seek to “organize serendipity” i.e. my experience is that unexpected great value is often to be found by bringing different communities in contact with each other. This has resulted in numerous Program Management and consultancy positions focussed on bringing together Information Technology, Innovation and Impact.

One of my key communities is the 'Institute for Accountability in the Digital Age' (I4ADA) which I chair. The institute was set up in 2017 at the instigation of UNESCO to seek 21st-century solutions on how to manage accountability in the Digital Age. To help find these solutions I4ADA is connecting a global multi stakeholder community consisting of national and local governments, international policy makers and institutes, NGOs, civil society, the ICT industry and platforms, as well as other relevant organizations.

I have been invited to speak at or moderate numerous events around the world. I have presented in Africa, Australia, China, Europe, India, New Zealand, South-Korea, Sri Lanka, the United States. I advise and coach organizations and other communities on community building, collaboration and strategy - the shift from “Command-and-Control” to "Connect-and-Collaborate" thinking. Examples include IT-Circle Netherlands, IPBPM - Portugal, General Council - Netherlands, Dutch Government Innovation Community - Netherlands, Innovation Network Flemish Government. I work on a couple of pro-bono projects including the ITU AI for Good Global Summit, YPO's Impact Summit and Digital Africa. I have written various articles for BPtrends, Executive People and BPMagazine.

I have developed my expertise through various senior commercial positions with a number of organizations including Logica, Cambridge Technology Partners and Staffware/Tibco. Since 2009 I am self-employed​.

projects.title: Strategic Counsel -  Institute for Future of Living
projects.description:
The Institute for Future of Living is a foundation under the laws of the Netherlands that merges the National Smart Cities Strategy as presented to prime minister Mark Rutte in 2017, collaborates with the Urban Society initiatives of the European Commission, and includes the Global Smart City and Community Coalition (GSC3) and related international matchmaking.

The Institute for Future of Living primarily facilitates and supports the public sector, both on local, national, regional and international levels, with current and future societal challenges and opportunities. For that, the Institute for Future of Living embraces the 2030 Sustainable Development Agenda as the overall goal to be achieved.

It does so by for instance initiating, promoting, facilitating and enhancing collaboration, navigation, strategic and operational excellence, transparency and accountability on co-creation, building and optimizing smart, human-centric, inclusive and sustainable societies, being the multi-helix combination of both public and private sector as well as research, educational and societal organizations.

The Institute for Future of Living is independent, non-partisan, not for profit and fully transparant.

Amongst others, the Institute has a global collaboration with World Bank

projects.title: Presenting at the Agile for Excellence conference
projects.description:
Agile Ecosystems – How to create shared purpose in an ever changing world?

Do we compete or collaborate? While digitalisation creates ever-new connections across legal, business, and cultural entities, we need to learn to benefit within such ecosystems. However, both alignment to a common purpose and sharing of assets have their limits. What are the rules of engagement, how to create a win-win in an ecosystem, and what are the leadership competencies required? The goals of the event are to learn, get inspired, and facilitate knowledge exchange within a community of practitioners, change agents, and researchers.

projects.title: Moderator conference "E-Skills and Jobs in the Digital Age"
projects.description: Moderated the conference: "E-Skills and Jobs in the Digital Age: Accelerating Europe’s Competitiveness and Inclusive Growth" organized by te Public Policy Exchange. Conference program included speakers from the European Commission, the European Parliament, Digital Champion, IT associations and academic speakers.

projects.title: ITU/XPRIZE: AI for Good Global Summit, Geneva
projects.description:
ITU and the XPRIZE Foundation organized the first AI for Good Global Summit in Geneva, 7-9 June, 2017 in partnership with a number of UN sister agencies. The Summit aimed to accelerate and advance the development and democratization of AI solutions that can address specific global challenges related to poverty, hunger, health, education, the environment, and others.

I have the honor to be a co-founder and dept chair of the outreach committee, and to moderate the session on Smart Cities and Communities.

On May 15-17 2018 the ITU organized the second AGGS. I have the honor to chair one of the plenary sessions.

The 3rd Summit was May 27-31 2019. With over 3300 delegated attending.

The 4th Summit is Scheduled for May 4th-8th @Geneva

profile_positions.description:
Het I-Partnerschap Rijk-Hoger Onderwijs is een unieke structurele samenwerking tussen het hoger onderwijs en de Rijksoverheid op IT-gebied. Via bijvoorbeeld stages, groepsopdrachten of innovatielabs werken studenten, onderzoekers en rijksorganisaties samen aan innovatieve oplossingen voor maatschappelijke vraagstukken uit de digitale praktijk.

Zo levert het I-Partnerschap een belangrijke bijdrage aan een snelle, veilige en betrouwbare digitale dienstverlening voor burgers en bedrijfsleven. Nu en in de toekomst.

Als Community manager ben ik verantwoordelijk voor het duurzaam bij elkaar brengen van personen en het verbinden van organisaties op relevante I-Partnerschap thema's.
profile_positions.title: Community Manager

company.name: Institute for Accountability in the Digital Age

profile_positions.company: Institute for Accountability in the Digital Age
profile_positions.description:
I chair the ‘Institute for Accountability in the Digital Age’ (I4ADA) based in The Hague. The institute was set up at the instigation of UNESCO to seek 21st-century solutions on how to manage accountability in the Digital Age. To help find these solutions I4ADA is building a global multi stakeholder community consisting of national and local governments, international policy makers and institutes, NGOs, civil society, the ICT industry and platforms, as well as other relevant organizations.

This institute organized the inaugural 'The Hague Summit for an Accountable & Democratic Internet - an internet of Values' on May 31st and June 1st 2018 in the Peace Place.  The Summit was organized in partnership with the city of The Hague, the ministry of the Interior and Kingdom relations and 2 UN agencies ITU and UNESCO. 

The Second Hague Summit for Accountability in the Digital Age was organized November 6-7th 2019 in the Peace Palace, The Hague.

I4ADA is invited to offer contributions to other organizations on a regular basis.

I4ADA is building up a database of I4ADA Dialogues with people from around the world to gather their views on Accountability in the Digital Age. These dialogues are available on the I4ADA website and via Spotify/Anchor.fm
profile_positions.title: Chairman

profile_positions.description: Founder and have been Chair of iPoort since the beginning and switch to co-chair in 2022. A part of the international press centre Nieuwspoort, The Hague. iPoort is a community which aims to promote the positive value and fundamental position digital technology has on the Dutch society. We organize regular sessions with Dutch politicians, the government, private industry and various relevant ICT organizations/associations.
profile_positions.title: Co-Chairman (Founder)

profile_positions.description:
The goals of the Competens Foundation are; Promoting the professional knowledge and competences of ICT professionals; promoting the use of standards for the benefit of ICT;
professional practice; contributing to the quality and social return of ICT applications; and promoting knowledge about the ICT field and ICT applications in Dutch society. The Competens Foundation consists of a Board and a Supervisory Board. The board receives and assesses applications for investments in initiatives that contribute to the development of IT competences. The Supervisory Board supervises good governance, but also contributes to the granting of support to initiatives.
profile_positions.title: Vice Chair Board of Directors

profile_positions.description:
‘The Brand Called You’ is a global platform that brings you Leadership Lessons, Knowledge, Experience and Wisdom from leading personalities from diverse backgrounds across the World. These are individuals who have contributed significantly to make the World a better place.

Converse with the brightest minds from the world of business, technology, professionals and social sector. Stay in the know as we talk to leaders, high achievers, thought leaders and high achievers from across the world.

Listen to the individuals who are moving and shaking the World with their words, thoughts, actions and deeds.

Find out what is going to shape the world.

To date (May '23) 1900+ people have been interviewed from 45+ countries generating 350M+ views.

profile_positions.description:
Korstmos is Dutch for "lichen". This is not a plant as most people assume but, a mutulistic symbiotic relationship where both organisms (alge and fungus) profit from the cooperation. It comes in all shapes and sizes and can be found all over the world. It grows slowly and only where the environment is clean. And, most people don't see it.

Korstmos is my metaphor for 'Connect-and-Collaborate": it requires a particular mind-set, each stake holder has to benefit, collaboration can be found anywhere, it takes time to build up trust, good collaboration is often transparent.
profile_positions.title: Owner

profile_positions.description:
IT-Circle is a Dutch community for IT professionals working at the demand site. Today about 50 organizations are member representing 24.000 IT professionals.

As strategic Counsel I supportive the board of IT-Circle on 'Community Building'.
